0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Aphthous ulcer of mouth: apply 1/4 inch (0.5 cm) of paste TOPICALLY to ulcer 4 times daily for up to 10 days
  • Aphthous ulcer of mouth: apply 1 mucoadhesive patch TOPICALLY to ulcer 4 times daily for up to 10 days, may use up to 3 patches at one time

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and effectiveness not established in children
  • Aphthous ulcer of mouth: 12 y and older, apply 1 mucoadhesive patch TOPICALLY to ulcer 4 times daily for up to 10 days, may use up to 3 patches at one time

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• discontinue use if rash or contact mucositis develops
  • wash hands immediately after application

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Application site pain, Transient (1% to 2%), Burning sensation (1% to 2%), Mucous membrane stinging (1% to 2%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Mucosal-Local: The exact mechanism of action is unknown. In vitro studies show amlexanox to inhibit the formation and release of histamine and leukotrienes from mast cells, neutrophils, and mononuclear cells.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • (paste/patch) apply following oral hygiene after meals and at bedtime; the evening dose of the patch should be applied within 80 minutes before bedtime
  • (paste) dry ulcer with clean cloth, put 1/4 inch (0.5 cm) on finger tip and apply with gentle pressure to ulcer, repeat process for each ulcer

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: symptomatic improvement, healing of ulcers, pain relief

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause a burning/stinging sensation or transient pain.
  • Instruct patient to report development of rash or contact mucositis.
  • Tell patient to report if no improvement noted after 10 days.
  • Patient should wash hands immediately after application.
